info.title: Corda HTTP RPC API
info.description: All the endpoints for publicly visible Open API calls

tags.name: CPI API
tags.description: The CPI API consists of a number of endpoints used to manage Corda Package Installer (CPI) files in the Corda cluster.

tags.name: Certificates API
tags.description: The Certificates API consists of endpoints used to work with certificates and related operations. The API allows you to import a certificate chain, and generate a certificate signing request (CSR) to be submitted to a certificate authority (CA).

tags.name: Configuration API
tags.description: The Configuration API consists of a number of endpoints used to manage the configuration of Corda clusters.

tags.name: Flow Info API
tags.description: The Flow Info API consists of a number of endpoints used to find out which flows can be invoked using the Flow Management API for a given identity.

tags.name: Flow Management API
tags.description: The Flow Management API consists of a number of endpoints used to interact with flows.

tags.name: HSM API
tags.description: The HSM API consists of endpoints used to work with Hardware Security Modules (HSM) for securely storing keys.

tags.name: Hello RPC API
tags.description: The Hello RPC API is used to test interactions via the HTTP-RPC API. It verifies that a call to HTTP-RPC can be made, and that the identity of the user making the call can be recognized. RBAC permissions are checked and the call is successfully processed by the HTTP-RPC worker.

tags.name: Keys Management API
tags.description: The Keys Management API consists of endpoints used to manage public and private key pairs. The API allows you to list scheme codes which are supported by the associated HSM integration, retrieve information about key pairs owned by a tenant, generate a key pair for a tenant, and retrieve a tenant's public key in PEM format.

tags.name: MGM API
tags.description: The MGM API consists of a number of endpoints used to manage membership groups. A membership group is a logical grouping of a number of Corda Identities to communicate and transact with one another with a specific set of CorDapps. The API allows you to generate the group policy for a membership group, required for new members to join the group.

tags.name: Member Lookup API
tags.description: The Member Lookup API consists of endpoints used to look up information related to membership groups.

tags.name: Member Registration API
tags.description: The Member Registration API consists of a number of endpoints which manage holding identities' participation in membership groups. To participate in a membership group, the holding identity is required to make a registration request that needs to be approved by the MGM for that group. This API allows you to start the registration process for a holding identity, and check the status of a previously created registration request.

tags.name: Network API
tags.description: The Network API consists of endpoints which manage the setup of holding identities in P2P networks.

tags.name: RBAC Permission API
tags.description: The RBAC Permission API consists of a number of endpoints enabling permissions management in the RBAC (role-based access control) permission system. You can get details of specified permissions and create new permissions.

tags.name: RBAC Role API
tags.description: The RBAC Role API consists of a number of endpoints enabling role management in the RBAC (role-based access control) permission system. You can get all roles in the system, create new roles and add and delete permissions from roles.

tags.name: RBAC User API
tags.description: The RBAC User API consists of a number of endpoints enabling user management in the RBAC (role-based access control) permission system. You can get details of specified users, create new users, assign roles to users and remove roles from users.

tags.name: Virtual Node API
tags.description: The Virtual Nodes API consists of a number of endpoints to manage virtual nodes.

tags.name: Virtual Node Maintenance API
tags.description: The Virtual Node Maintenance API consists of a series of endpoints used for virtual node management.Warning: Using these endpoints could be highly disruptive, so great care should be taken when using them.

get.description: This method gets the certificate chain aliases for a cluster.

parameters.name: usage
parameters.description: The certificate usage. Can be either 'p2p-tls' for a TLS certificate to be used in P2P communication, 'p2p-session' for a session certificate to be used in P2P communication, 'rpc-api-tls' for a TLS certificate to be used in RPC API communication, or 'code-signer' for a certificate of the code signing service.

schema.description: The certificate usage. Can be either 'p2p-tls' for a TLS certificate to be used in P2P communication, 'p2p-session' for a session certificate to be used in P2P communication, 'rpc-api-tls' for a TLS certificate to be used in RPC API communication, or 'code-signer' for a certificate of the code signing service.

200.description: The cluster level certificates aliases in the usage.

put.description: This method imports a certificate chain for a cluster.

parameters.name: usage
parameters.description: The certificate usage. Can be either 'p2p-tls' for a TLS certificate to be used in P2P communication, 'p2p-session' for a session certificate to be used in P2P communication, 'rpc-api-tls' for a TLS certificate to be used in RPC API communication, or 'code-signer' for a certificate of the code signing service.

schema.description: The certificate usage. Can be either 'p2p-tls' for a TLS certificate to be used in P2P communication, 'p2p-session' for a session certificate to be used in P2P communication, 'rpc-api-tls' for a TLS certificate to be used in RPC API communication, or 'code-signer' for a certificate of the code signing service.

alias.description: The unique alias under which the certificate chain will be stored

items.description: A content of the file to upload.
items.example: No example available for this type

200.description: Success

parameters.name: tenantid
parameters.description: Can either be a holding identity ID, the value 'p2p' for a cluster-level tenant of the P2P services, or the value 'rpc-api' for a cluster-level tenant of the HTTP RPC API

schema.description: Can either be a holding identity ID, the value 'p2p' for a cluster-level tenant of the P2P services, or the value 'rpc-api' for a cluster-level tenant of the HTTP RPC API

parameters.name: keyid
parameters.description: Identifier of the public key that will be included in the certificate

schema.description: Identifier of the public key that will be included in the certificate

200.description: The CSR in PEM format.

put.description: This method updates a section of the cluster configuration.

200.description:
The updated cluster configuration for the specified section:
            - `section`: the section of the configuration to be updated.
            - `config`: the updated configuration in JSON or HOCON format.
            - `schemaVersion`: the schema version of the configuration.
            - `version`: the version number used for optimistic locking. The request fails if this version does not 
                match the version stored in the database for the corresponding section or -1 if this is a new section 
                for which no configuration has yet been stored.
An integer value specifying the version of the endpoint

get.description: This method returns the 'active' configuration for the given section, in both the 'raw' format and with defaults applied.

parameters.name: section
parameters.description: Section name for the configuration.

schema.description: Section name for the configuration.

200.description: The configuration for the given section

get.description: The GET method returns a list of all CPIs uploaded to the cluster.

200.description: Details of all of the CPIs uploaded to the cluster.

post.description: This method uses the POST method to upload a Corda Package Installer (CPI) file to the Corda cluster.

upload.description: The CPI file to be uploaded.
upload.example: No example available for this type

200.description: The ID for the CPI upload request
An integer value specifying the version of the endpoint

get.description: The status endpoint uses the GET method to return status information for the CPI upload with the given request ID.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID returned from the CPI upload request.

schema.description: The ID returned from the CPI upload request.

200.description: Success
An integer value specifying the version of the endpoint

get.description: This method returns an array containing the statuses of all flows running for a specified holding identity. An empty array is returned if there are no flows running.

parameters.name: holdingidentityshorthash
parameters.description: The short hash of the holding identity; obtained during node registration

schema.description: The short hash of the holding identity; obtained during node registration

200.description:
A collection of statuses for the flow instances, including:
            
            holdingIdentityShortHash: The short form hash of the Holding Identity
            clientRequestId: The unique ID supplied by the client when the flow was created.
            flowId: The internal unique ID for the flow.
            flowStatus: The current state of the executing flow.
            flowResult: The result returned from a completed flow, only set when the flow status is 'COMPLETED' otherwise null
            flowError: The details of the error that caused a flow to fail, only set when the flow status is 'FAILED' otherwise null
            timestamp: The timestamp of when the status was last updated (in UTC)

post.description: This method starts a new instance for the specified flow for the specified holding identity.

parameters.name: holdingidentityshorthash
parameters.description: The short hash of the holding identity; obtained during node registration

schema.description: The short hash of the holding identity; obtained during node registration

200.description:
The initial status of the flow instance; if the flow already exists, then the status of the existing flow will be returned.
            
            holdingIdentityShortHash: The short form hash of the holding identity
            clientRequestId: The unique ID supplied by the client when the flow was created.
            flowId: The internal unique ID for the flow.
            flowStatus: The current state of the executing flow.
            flowResult: The result returned from a completed flow, only set when the flow status is 'COMPLETED' otherwise null
            flowError: The details of the error that caused a flow to fail, only set when the flow status is 'FAILED' otherwise null
            timestamp: The timestamp of when the status was last updated (in UTC)

get.description: This method gets the current status of the specified flow instance.

parameters.name: holdingidentityshorthash
parameters.description: The short hash of the holding identity; obtained during node registration

schema.description: The short hash of the holding identity; obtained during node registration

parameters.name: clientrequestid
parameters.description: Client provided flow identifier

schema.description: Client provided flow identifier

200.description:
The status of the flow instance, including:
            
            holdingIdentityShortHash: The short form hash of the Holding Identity
            clientRequestId: The unique ID supplied by the client when the flow was created.
            flowId: The internal unique ID for the flow.
            flowStatus: The current state of the executing flow.
            flowResult: The result returned from a completed flow, only set when the flow status is 'COMPLETED' otherwise null
            flowError: The details of the error that caused a flow to fail, only set when the flow status is 'FAILED' otherwise null
            timestamp: The timestamp of when the status was last updated (in UTC)
An integer value specifying the version of the endpoint

get.description: This method gets all flows that can be used by the specified holding identity.

parameters.name: holdingidentityshorthash
parameters.description: The short hash of the holding identity; this is obtained during node registration

schema.description: The short hash of the holding identity; this is obtained during node registration

200.description: The class names of all flows that can be run

post.description: This method produces a greeting phrase for the addressee.

parameters.name: addressee
parameters.description: An arbitrary name can be used for the greeting.

schema.description: An arbitrary name can be used for the greeting.

200.description: A greeting phrase for the addressee
An integer value specifying the version of the endpoint
An integer value specifying the version of the endpoint

post.description: This method enables you to assign a soft HSM to the tenant for the specified category.

parameters.name: tenantid
parameters.description: Can either be a holding identity ID, the value 'p2p' for a cluster-level tenant of the P2P services, or the value 'rpc-api' for a cluster-level tenant of the HTTP RPC API

schema.description: Can either be a holding identity ID, the value 'p2p' for a cluster-level tenant of the P2P services, or the value 'rpc-api' for a cluster-level tenant of the HTTP RPC API

parameters.name: category
parameters.description: The category of the HSM; can be the value 'ACCOUNTS', 'CI', 'LEDGER', 'NOTARY', 'SESSION_INIT', 'TLS', or 'JWT_KEY'

schema.description: The category of the HSM; can be the value 'ACCOUNTS', 'CI', 'LEDGER', 'NOTARY', 'SESSION_INIT', 'TLS', or 'JWT_KEY'

200.description:
The HSM association details including:
            id: the unique identifier of the HSM association
            hsmId: the HSM identifier included into the association
            category: the category of the HSM; can be the value 'ACCOUNTS', 'CI', 'LEDGER', 'NOTARY', 'SESSION_INIT', 
                'TLS', or 'JWT_KEY'
            masterKeyAlias: optional master key alias to be used on HSM
            deprecatedAt: time when the association was deprecated, epoch time in seconds; 
                value of 0 means the association is active

get.description: This method retrieves information on the HSM of the specified category assigned to the tenant.

parameters.name: tenantid
parameters.description: Can either be a holding identity ID, the value 'p2p' for a cluster-level tenant of the P2P services, or the value 'rpc-api' for a cluster-level tenant of the HTTP RPC API

schema.description: Can either be a holding identity ID, the value 'p2p' for a cluster-level tenant of the P2P services, or the value 'rpc-api' for a cluster-level tenant of the HTTP RPC API

parameters.name: category
parameters.description: The category of the HSM; can be the value 'ACCOUNTS', 'CI', 'LEDGER', 'NOTARY', 'SESSION_INIT', 'TLS', or 'JWT_KEY'

schema.description: The category of the HSM; can be the value 'ACCOUNTS', 'CI', 'LEDGER', 'NOTARY', 'SESSION_INIT', 'TLS', or 'JWT_KEY'

200.description:
The HSM association details including:
            id: the unique identifier of the HSM association
            hsmId: the HSM identifier included into the association
            category: the category of the HSM; can be the value 'ACCOUNTS', 'CI', 'LEDGER', 'NOTARY', 'SESSION_INIT', 
                'TLS', or 'JWT_KEY'
            masterKeyAlias: optional master key alias to be used on HSM
            deprecatedAt: time when the association was deprecated, epoch time in seconds; 
                value of 0 means the association is active

post.description: This method enables you to assign a hardware-backed HSM to the tenant for the specified category.

parameters.name: tenantid
parameters.description: Can either be a holding identity ID, the value 'p2p' for a cluster-level tenant of the P2P services, or the value 'rpc-api' for a cluster-level tenant of the HTTP RPC API

schema.description: Can either be a holding identity ID, the value 'p2p' for a cluster-level tenant of the P2P services, or the value 'rpc-api' for a cluster-level tenant of the HTTP RPC API

parameters.name: category
parameters.description: The category of the HSM; can be the value 'ACCOUNTS', 'CI', 'LEDGER', 'NOTARY', 'SESSION_INIT', 'TLS', or 'JWT_KEY'

schema.description: The category of the HSM; can be the value 'ACCOUNTS', 'CI', 'LEDGER', 'NOTARY', 'SESSION_INIT', 'TLS', or 'JWT_KEY'

200.description:
The HSM association details including:
            id: the unique identifier of the HSM association
            hsmId: the HSM identifier included into the association
            category: the category of the HSM; can be the value 'ACCOUNTS', 'CI', 'LEDGER', 'NOTARY', 'SESSION_INIT', 
                'TLS', or 'JWT_KEY'
            masterKeyAlias: optional master key alias to be used on HSM
            deprecatedAt: time when the association was deprecated, epoch time in seconds; 
                value of 0 means the association is active
An integer value specifying the version of the endpoint

get.description: This method retrieves information about a list of key pairs belonging to a tenant.

parameters.name: tenantid
parameters.description: Can either be a holding identity ID, the value 'p2p' for a cluster-level tenant of the P2P services, or the value 'rpc-api' for a cluster-level tenant of the HTTP RPC API

schema.description: Can either be a holding identity ID, the value 'p2p' for a cluster-level tenant of the P2P services, or the value 'rpc-api' for a cluster-level tenant of the HTTP RPC API

parameters.name: skip
parameters.description: The response paging information, number of records to skip

schema.description: The response paging information, number of records to skip

parameters.name: take
parameters.description: The response paging information, that is, the number of records to return. The actual number returned may be less than requested.

schema.description: The response paging information, that is, the number of records to return. The actual number returned may be less than requested.

parameters.name: orderby
parameters.description: Specifies how to order the results. Can be one of 'NONE', 'TIMESTAMP', 'CATEGORY', 'SCHEME_CODE_NAME', 'ALIAS', 'MASTER_KEY_ALIAS', 'EXTERNAL_ID', 'ID', 'TIMESTAMP_DESC', 'CATEGORY_DESC', 'SCHEME_CODE_NAME_DESC', 'ALIAS_DESC', 'MASTER_KEY_ALIAS_DESC', 'EXTERNAL_ID_DESC', 'ID_DESC'.

schema.description: Specifies how to order the results. Can be one of 'NONE', 'TIMESTAMP', 'CATEGORY', 'SCHEME_CODE_NAME', 'ALIAS', 'MASTER_KEY_ALIAS', 'EXTERNAL_ID', 'ID', 'TIMESTAMP_DESC', 'CATEGORY_DESC', 'SCHEME_CODE_NAME_DESC', 'ALIAS_DESC', 'MASTER_KEY_ALIAS_DESC', 'EXTERNAL_ID_DESC', 'ID_DESC'.

parameters.name: category
parameters.description: Category of the HSM which handles the key pairs. Can be one of 'ACCOUNTS', 'CI', 'LEDGER', 'NOTARY', 'SESSION_INIT', 'TLS', 'JWT_KEY'.

schema.description: Category of the HSM which handles the key pairs. Can be one of 'ACCOUNTS', 'CI', 'LEDGER', 'NOTARY', 'SESSION_INIT', 'TLS', 'JWT_KEY'.

parameters.name: schemecodename
parameters.description: The key pairs' signature scheme name. For example, 'CORDA.RSA', 'CORDA.ECDSA.SECP256K1', 'CORDA.ECDSA.SECP256R1', 'CORDA.EDDSA.ED25519', 'CORDA.SPHINCS-256'.

schema.description: The key pairs' signature scheme name. For example, 'CORDA.RSA', 'CORDA.ECDSA.SECP256K1', 'CORDA.ECDSA.SECP256R1', 'CORDA.EDDSA.ED25519', 'CORDA.SPHINCS-256'.

parameters.name: alias
parameters.description: The alias under which the key pair is stored

schema.description: The alias under which the key pair is stored

parameters.name: masterkeyalias
parameters.description: The alias of the wrapping key

schema.description: The alias of the wrapping key

parameters.name: createdafter
parameters.description: Only include key pairs which were created on or after the specified time. Must be a valid instant in UTC, such as 2022-12-03T10:15:30.00Z.

schema.description: Only include key pairs which were created on or after the specified time. Must be a valid instant in UTC, such as 2022-12-03T10:15:30.00Z.

parameters.name: createdbefore
parameters.description: Only include key pairs which were created on or before the specified time. Must be a valid instant in UTC, such as 2022-12-03T10:15:30.00Z.

schema.description: Only include key pairs which were created on or before the specified time. Must be a valid instant in UTC, such as 2022-12-03T10:15:30.00Z.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Only include key pairs associated with the specified list of key IDs. If specified, other filter parameters will be ignored.

200.description: A map of key IDs to the respective key pair information

schema.example: No example available for this type

post.description: This method generates a new key pair for a tenant.

parameters.name: tenantid
parameters.description: Can either be a holding identity ID, the value 'p2p' for a cluster-level tenant of the P2P services, or the value 'rpc-api' for a cluster-level tenant of the HTTP RPC API

schema.description: Can either be a holding identity ID, the value 'p2p' for a cluster-level tenant of the P2P services, or the value 'rpc-api' for a cluster-level tenant of the HTTP RPC API

parameters.name: alias
parameters.description: The alias under which the new key pair will be stored

schema.description: The alias under which the new key pair will be stored

parameters.name: hsmcategory
parameters.description: Category of the HSM which handles the key pairs. Can be one of 'ACCOUNTS', 'CI', 'LEDGER', 'NOTARY', 'SESSION_INIT', 'TLS', 'JWT_KEY'.

schema.description: Category of the HSM which handles the key pairs. Can be one of 'ACCOUNTS', 'CI', 'LEDGER', 'NOTARY', 'SESSION_INIT', 'TLS', 'JWT_KEY'.

parameters.name: scheme
parameters.description: The key's scheme describing which type of the key pair to generate. For example, 'CORDA.RSA', 'CORDA.ECDSA.SECP256K1', 'CORDA.ECDSA.SECP256R1', 'CORDA.EDDSA.ED25519', 'CORDA.SPHINCS-256'.

schema.description: The key's scheme describing which type of the key pair to generate. For example, 'CORDA.RSA', 'CORDA.ECDSA.SECP256K1', 'CORDA.ECDSA.SECP256R1', 'CORDA.EDDSA.ED25519', 'CORDA.SPHINCS-256'.

200.description: The ID of the newly generated key pair

get.description: This method retrieves a list of supported key schemes for a specified tenant and HSM category.

parameters.name: tenantid
parameters.description: Can either be a holding identity ID, the value 'p2p' for a cluster-level tenant of the P2P services, or the value 'rpc-api' for a cluster-level tenant of the HTTP RPC API

schema.description: Can either be a holding identity ID, the value 'p2p' for a cluster-level tenant of the P2P services, or the value 'rpc-api' for a cluster-level tenant of the HTTP RPC API

parameters.name: hsmcategory
parameters.description: The category of the HSM. Can be the value 'ACCOUNTS', 'CI', 'LEDGER', 'NOTARY', 'SESSION_INIT', 'TLS', or 'JWT_KEY'

schema.description: The category of the HSM. Can be the value 'ACCOUNTS', 'CI', 'LEDGER', 'NOTARY', 'SESSION_INIT', 'TLS', or 'JWT_KEY'

200.description: The list of scheme codes which are supported by the associated HSM integration

get.description: This method retrieves a tenant's public key in PEM format.

parameters.name: tenantid
parameters.description: Can either be a holding identity ID, the value 'p2p' for a cluster-level tenant of the P2P services, or the value 'rpc-api' for a cluster-level tenant of the HTTP RPC API

schema.description: Can either be a holding identity ID, the value 'p2p' for a cluster-level tenant of the P2P services, or the value 'rpc-api' for a cluster-level tenant of the HTTP RPC API

parameters.name: keyid
parameters.description: Identifier of the public key to be retrieved

schema.description: Identifier of the public key to be retrieved

200.description: The public key in PEM format

post.description: Even if CPI with the same metadata has already been uploaded, this endpoint will overwrite the previously stored CPI record. This operation also purges any sandboxes running an overwritten version of a CPI. This action can take some time to process, therefore it is performed asynchronously.

upload.description: A content of the file to upload.
upload.example: No example available for this type

200.description: The response ID which can be used to track the progress of the force CPI upload operation.
An integer value specifying the version of the endpoint

post.description: Rollback the virtual node database for the given virtual node short ID. Then apply current CPI migrations. This operation is destructive and will result in user vault data being deleted, but will not have any effect on system tables.

parameters.name: virtualnodeshortid
parameters.description: Short ID of the virtual node instance to rollback

schema.description: Short ID of the virtual node instance to rollback

200.description: A list of the shortIDs or the exception encountered
An integer value specifying the version of the endpoint

get.description: This method retrieves a list of all active and pending members in the membership group.

schema.description: Holding identity ID of the requesting member. The result only contains members that are visible to this member

parameters.description: Common Name (CN) attribute of the X.500 name to filter members by

parameters.name: o
parameters.description: Organization (O) attribute of the X.500 name to filter members by

schema.description: Organization (O) attribute of the X.500 name to filter members by

parameters.name: ou
parameters.description: Organization Unit (OU) attribute of the X.500 name to filter members by

schema.description: Organization Unit (OU) attribute of the X.500 name to filter members by

parameters.name: l
parameters.description: Locality (L) attribute of the X.500 name to filter members by

schema.description: Locality (L) attribute of the X.500 name to filter members by

parameters.name: st
parameters.description: State (ST) attribute of the X.500 name to filter members by

schema.description: State (ST) attribute of the X.500 name to filter members by

parameters.name: c
parameters.description: Country (C) attribute of the X.500 name to filter members by

schema.description: Country (C) attribute of the X.500 name to filter members by

200.description: Success
An integer value specifying the version of the endpoint

get.description: This method checks the statuses of all registration requests for a specified holding identity.

parameters.name: holdingidentityshorthash
parameters.description: The ID of the holding identity whose registration progress is to be checked

schema.description: The ID of the holding identity whose registration progress is to be checked

200.description:
The registration status information, including:
            registrationId: the registration request ID
            registrationSent: the date and the when the registration progress started; 
                value of null indicated that registration has not started yet
            registrationUpdated: the date and the when the registration has been last updated    
            registrationStatus: the status of the registration request; 
                possible values are "NEW", "PENDING_MEMBER_VERIFICATION", "PENDING_APPROVAL_FLOW", 
                "PENDING_MANUAL_APPROVAL", "PENDING_AUTO_APPROVAL", "DECLINED", or "APPROVED"
            memberInfoSubmitted: the properties submitted to MGM during the registration

post.description: This method starts the registration process for a holding identity.

parameters.name: holdingidentityshorthash
parameters.description: The holding identity ID of the requesting virtual node

schema.description: The holding identity ID of the requesting virtual node

200.description:
The registration progress information, including:
            registrationId: the registration request ID
            registrationSent: the date and the when the registration progress started; 
                value of null indicated that registration has not started yet
            registrationStatus: the status of the registration request; 
                possible values are "SUBMITTED and "NOT_SUBMITTED"
            memberInfoSubmitted: the properties submitted to MGM during the registration

The registration status information, including:

                value of null indicated that registration has not started yet
            registrationUpdated: the date and the when the registration has been last updated    
            registrationStatus: the status of the registration request; 
                possible values are "NEW", "PENDING_MEMBER_VERIFICATION", "PENDING_APPROVAL_FLOW", 
                "PENDING_MANUAL_APPROVAL", "PENDING_AUTO_APPROVAL", "DECLINED", or "APPROVED"
            memberInfoSubmitted: the properties submitted to MGM during the registration

get.description: This method returns permissions which satisfy supplied query criteria.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of results to return. The value must be in the range [1..1000].

schema.description: The maximum number of results to return. The value must be in the range [1..1000].

parameters.name: permissiontype
parameters.description: The permission type to be returned.

schema.description: The permission type to be returned.

parameters.name: groupvisibility
parameters.description: Optional group visibility for a permission.

schema.description: Optional group visibility for a permission.

parameters.name: virtualnode
parameters.description: Optional virtual node the permissions apply to.

schema.description: Optional virtual node the permissions apply to.

parameters.name: permissionstringprefix
parameters.description: Optional permission string prefix for permissions to be located.

schema.description: Optional permission string prefix for permissions to be located.

200.description: Permissions which satisfy supplied query criteria

post.description: This method creates a new permission.

200.description:
id: The server-side generated ID of the new permission
        permissionType: Defines whether this is an ALLOW or DENY type of permission
        permissionString: A machine-parseable string representing an individual permission; 
            it can be any arbitrary string as long as the authorization code can make use of it in the context of user 
            permission matching
        groupVisibility: An optional group visibility identifier of the permission
        virtualNode: An optional identifier of the virtual node to which the physical node permission applies
        version: The version number of the permission; a value of 0 is assigned to a newly-created permission
        updateTimestamp: The server-side timestamp showing when the permission was created

post.description: This method creates a set of permissions and optionally assigns them to the existing roles.

200.description: A set of identifiers for permissions created along with role identifiers they were associated with.
An integer value specifying the version of the endpoint

            it can be any arbitrary string as long as the authorization code can make use of it in the context of user 
            permission matching

get.description: This method returns a user based on the specified login name.

parameters.name: loginname
parameters.description: The login name of the user to be returned

schema.description: The login name of the user to be returned

200.description:
A newly created user with the following attributes:
            id: Unique server generated identifier for the user
            version: The version of the user; version 0 is assigned to a newly created user
            updateTimestamp: The date and time when the user was last updated
            fullName: The full name for the new user
            loginName: The login name for the new user
            enabled: If true, the user account is enabled; false, the account is disabled
            ssoAuth: If true, the user account is enabled for SSO authentication; 
                false, the account is enabled for password authentication
            passwordExpiry: The date and time when the password should expire, specified as an ISO-8601 string;
                    value of null means that the password does not expire
            parentGroup: An optional identifier of the user group for the new user to be included;
                    value of null means that the user will belong to the root group
            properties: An optional set of key/value properties associated with a user account
            roleAssociations: A set of roles associated with the user account

post.description: This method creates a new user.

200.description:
A newly created user with the following attributes:
            id: Unique server generated identifier for the user

            updateTimestamp: The date and time when the user was last updated
            fullName: The full name for the new user
            loginName: The login name for the new user
            enabled: If true, the user account is enabled; false, the account is disabled
            ssoAuth: If true, the user account is enabled for SSO authentication; 
                false, the account is enabled for password authentication
            passwordExpiry: The date and time when the password should expire, specified as an ISO-8601 string;
                    value of null means that the password does not expire

                    value of null means that the user will belong to the root group
            properties: An optional set of key/value properties associated with a user account
            roleAssociations: A set of roles associated with the user account

contextMap.description: Used to add additional attributes to the CSR; for example, signature spec
contextMap.example: No example available for this type

x500Name.description: The X.500 name that will be the subject associated with the request

HostedIdentitySetupRequest.description:
Request object which contains properties for P2P messaging including:
                p2pTlsCertificateChainAlias: the P2P TLS certificate chain alias
                useClusterLevelTlsCertificateAndKey: Should the cluster-level P2P TLS certificate type and key be 
                used or the virtual node certificate and key.
                useClusterLevelSessionCertificateAndKey: Should the cluster-level P2P SESSION certificate type 
                and key be used or the virtual node certificate and key.
                sessionKeyId: the session key identifier

data.example: No example available for this type

context.example: No example available for this type

MemberRegistrationRequest.description: The request sent during registration which contains the requested registration action (e.g. 'requestJoin') along with a context map containing data required to initiate the registration process.

memberContext.example: No example available for this type

mgmContext.example: No example available for this type

requestData.description: Can be any value - string, number, boolean, array or object.

StartFlowParameters.description:
Information required to start a flow for this holdingId, including:
                clientRequestId: a client provided flow identifier
                flowClassName: fully qualified class name of the flow to start
                requestData: optional start arguments string passed to the flow; defaults to an empty string

config.description: Can be any value - string, number, boolean, array or object.

UpdateConfigParameters.description:
Details of the updated configuration. Includes:
            - `section`: the section of the configuration to be updated.
            - `config`: the updated configuration in JSON or HOCON format.
            - `schemaVersion`: the schema version of the configuration.
            - `version`: the version number used for optimistic locking. The request fails if this version does not 
                match the version stored in the database for the corresponding section or -1 if this is a new section 
                for which no configuration has yet been stored.

VirtualNodeRequest.description: Details of the virtual node to be created
